name: Hotel Arcobaleno

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Arcobaleno Hotel in Siena for 4 nights during the first week of May, 2008. The staff was wonderful. Upon our arrival we were given a nice map of Siena and shown the easiest way to walk into the center of Siena. Throughout our stay they answered several questions we had and were very friendly and helpful. Our room was fairly large and decorated nicely. It was also very, very clean. I was amazed at how well the room was cleaned and straightened up each day. The breakfast in the morning was not extensive but still good. We used the Internet point in the lobby and it was very fast and reliable. The charge was 3 euros for 1 hour.
reviews.title: Terrific Staff, Horrible Shower
Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: It took us about 30 minutes to walk to the main square in Siena from the hotel. Because we only spent one day visiting Siena and spent the rest of the time going to other towns in the area this didn't really bother us. However, if someone was planning on spending most of their time in the center of Siena, the walk to and from the hotel might get old.

My biggest complaint about our stay was the shower in the bathroom. It was not just a shower - it was also a bidet! It was very small and I know a few people that probably wouldn't fit in it. The doors didn't close well and water collected on the floor each time it was on. I dreaded having to use it every morning. The outlet for high powered devices in the room wouldn't work so I couldn't plug in my blow dryer and had to use the one in the bathroom instead. The bathroom's blow dryer didn't work well, so I found having to use it very annoying. The room also had thin walls - we could hear people in neighboring rooms quite often. Because of these issues if we ever traveled to Tuscany again we would find a different hotel to stay in.
reviews.title: adequate stay

reviews.text: We truly enjoyed our stay at Arcobaleno. Very cozy and warm feel to the hotel. Rooms have been recently updated and are modern looking. Excellent continental breakfast and friendly staff. Distance from city centre is the only drawback. It's a 20-25 minute walk to the city centre. The first 5 minutres of the walk are not enjoyable as you are on a secondary route. Location come is handy is you have a car with you as parking is free. The bus stop is a 3 minute walk and will take you to the city centre for 1 Euro. Would highly recommend this hotel. Great value for your money.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.disliked: — longish walk into town and to the train station

reviews.text: The receptionist (don't know her name) was very helpful in suggesting two excellent restaurants - Trattoria Papei & La Taverno Di Cecco.
reviews.title: OK accommodation... has its pros and its cons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would gladly stay here again.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I were lucky enough to return to Italy over Easter week this year (we were there for 2 weeks last June) and had not made it to Siena last trip. Booked the trip and this hotel only 2 weeks before going and really loved it.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel & Location in Siena - FREE PARKING!

reviews.text: There are new owners and Christina and the whole staff are very helpful and keep the 2 buildings that house their hotel immaculately clean! A great perk is that they have a large parking lot with EASY access and it's free - which in Italy is enormous. When we were there they were in the process of remodeling their restaurant which I think will be lovely. The breakfast area is in a kind of 3 season room and lovely.
reviews.title: Arcobaleno Siena is great!

likes.liked: — great staff, clean, comfortable, great location

reviews.text: The location is great - about 1 km. to inside the city walls - about a 10 minute walk - which considering how much we walk (and eat) it Italy, it is nothing. Do think the rooms are plainer than many and a little more expensive (130 euros)than we even paid in Venice for a great boutique hotel.
reviews.title: fantastic experience at arcobaleno hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again when we get back to Siena!
reviews.title: Great Value/Friendliest staff in Italy

reviews.text: The staff was extremely friendly and helpful! they helped us arrange for local tours of the Siena area, bus service to Florence, taxis, train. We consulted with them on our research on places to eat and found them most helpful. Staff made reservations for restaurants and local tours. Rooms very comfortable. Location is very convenient for train and bus service. Taxis easily reach center of town in a few minutes. They make good cocktails too!
reviews.title: Loved Arcobaleno

reviews.text: We stayed here for just one night while traveling through Tuscany. The rooms were clean, well-maintained and comfortable. My mother and I shared a room with 2 twin beds which are really more like nice cots. So they are a little bouncy and quite soft, but these types of beds are common in Italy so we did not mind. The breakfast was a typical light Italian one with pastries, fruit, yogurt and cappuccino. The breakfast room is a sun room with a lovely view and there is a nice patio area with comfortable seating. The parking is right on the backside of the building and it is only 10 minutes drive or less to historic Siena. This place is simple but dependably comfortable for a two star.
reviews.title: Delightful and Comfortable

reviews.text: This is a nice hotel with friendly staff and nice rooms but it's a bit out of town. We had to take cabs into Siena or walk (about a 30 min walk). The breakfast is free and decent (nothing hot). I'd stay here again but might look for something closer to the center of town. This hotel does have parking.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel a Bit Out of the Way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small hotel about a 10 min. drive into old Sienna. Small but clean rooms. Breakfast a bit skimpy but OK. Limited free parking on site. Adjacent restaurant not owned by hotel. Overpriced.
reviews.title: Too far out of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Arcobaleno, located in North Siena, Italy is a nice refuge. Sisters Claudia and Laura take turns manning the front desk and they are charming, knowledgeable and very helpful. There is a restaurant below the hotel that is excellent, also with a great, fun-loving staff. About a safe, 20 minute walk from the main Campo Hotel Arcobaleno is convenient and just off the Autostrada for those who have a car. Plenty of parking is available. Room 303 has a beautiful view out over the Tuscan countryside.
reviews.title: Excellent loacation, clean rooms, great staff

reviews.text: We stayed here for a friend's wedding - most of the wedding party stayed here. Claudia literally was the wedding planner, helping get flowers, arrange vans to the main Piazza, choosing the restaurant, and making sure everything went flawlessly. For her alone, I would go back to this hotel and recommend it. Its quite the bargain at 90 Euros for a triple, but it was quite loud, the rooms very small, the shower a complete joke, the hairdryer downright scary, but it was clean and the beds comfortable. They have parking, will arrange tours, is a short walk from the train station (no shuttle), and serve a decent breakfast in the lobby. The outdoor patio is quite nice, they have internet access, and small playground for small children. The coffee is quite marginal, which is odd for Italy. I would not recommend the restaurant downstairs as it is not run by the hotel and the staff was downright hostile. There seemed to be some kind of spat happening between the hotel and the restaurant. The hotel staff is really amazing, incredibly helpful, and will make sure your stay in Siena the best possible.
reviews.title: Claudia makes this hotel worth the effort

description: The magic and charm of nineteenth-century Tuscany;the irresistible allure of Chianti's colours;the indispensable modern comforts.All of these can be found at Hotel Arcobaleno,which is situated in an enchanting country villa from the 1800s at the gates of Siena.The hotel has 19 rooms, each of the hotel's bedrooms has a private bathroom with shower and hairdryer, color cable television, direct dial digital telephone, WiiFi connection and individual air conditioning and heating.
